Adhola: Mac
English: Fire
Swahili: Moto

Adhola: A nen mac!
English: Look, fire!
Swahili: Angalia, moto!

Adhola: Mac waŋo gi kipiny
English: Fire burns
Swahili: Moto unachoma

Adhola: Watedo gi mac
English: Fire cooks
Swahili: Moto unatumika kupika

Adhola: Mac kelo ri wan lyetho
English: Fire gives warmth
Swahili: Moto unaleta joto

Adhola: Mac miyo wan lero
English: Fire gives light
Swahili: Moto unaleta mwanga

Adhola: A nen mac!
English: Look, fire!
Swahili: Angalia, moto!

Adhola: Mac obedo gi maber
English: Fire is wonderful
Swahili: Moto ni wa ajabu

Adhola: Aka ni gi men
English: And it is powerful
Swahili: Na una nguvu sana

Adhola: Tedo
English: Cooking
Swahili: Kupika

Adhola: Agowo rabwo
English: I peel the potatoes
Swahili: Ninamenya viazi

Adhola: Anyaro kabico
English: I chop a cabbage
Swahili: Ninakatakata kabichi

Adhola: Agweno karoti
English: I grate the carrots
Swahili: Ninasaga karoti

Adhola: Alwoko bijanjali
English: I wash the beans
Swahili: Ninaosha maharagwe

Adhola: Aŋado nyaryeŋa
English: I cut the butternut
Swahili: Ninakata maboga

Adhola: Anyaro siku mawiki
English: I chop the spinach
Swahili: Ninakatakata sukuma-wiki

Adhola: Mama ŋado katungulu
English:
My mom chops the
onions
Swahili: Mama yangu anakatakata vitunguu

Adhola: Katungulu m’oŋadi lunga i waŋan
English:
Onions make me cry
when they are chopped
Swahili: Vitunguu hunifanya nilie vikiwa vinakatwakatwa

Adhola: Jali Ma Bori Tektek Swa
English: A very tall man
Swahili: Mwanamume mrefu

Adhola: kweri pere oyido chieki swa
English: His hoe was too short
Swahili: Jembe lake lilikuwa fupi mno

Adhola: Dhioti pere oyido ni pinyi swa
English: His doorway was too low
Swahili: Mlango wake ulikuwa chini mno

Adhola: Kitanda pere oyido cheiki swa
English: His bed was too short
Swahili: Kitanda chake kilikuwa kifupi mno

Adhola: Gali pere oyido chieki swa
English: His bicycle was too short
Swahili: Baisikeli yake ilikuwa fupi sana

Adhola: Jaali me oyido bori swa!
English: This man was too tall!
Swahili: Mtu huyu alikuwa mrefu zaidi!

Adhola: Go oyiko furi kweri mabori swa
English: He made a very long hoe handle
Swahili: Alitengeneza mpini wa jembe mrefu sana

Adhola: Go oyiko gute thigo pere mabori swa
English: He made very high door frames
Swahili: Alitengeneza fremu ndefu za milango

Adhola: Go oyiko kitanda mabori swa
English: He made a very long bed
Swahili: Alitengeneza kitanda kirefu sana

Adhola: Go onyiewo gali manitye malo swa
English: He bought a very high bicycle
Swahili: Akanunua baisikeli iliyokuwa ndefu mno

Adhola: Go obedo i komi ma bori swa
English: He sat on a very high chair
Swahili: Aliketi juu ya kiti kilichokuwa juu sana

Adhola: Go ochiemo gi wuma ma bori swa
English: He ate with a very long fork
Swahili: Alikula kwa kutumia uma iliyokuwa ndefu mno

Adhola: Go oweyo pecho pere to chako bedo iluli
English: He left his house and lived in a big forest
Swahili: Aliacha nyumba yake na kuishi katika msitu mkubwa

Adhola: Go obedo ma oro kweth
English: He lived for many years
Swahili: Aliishi kwa miaka mingi

Adhola: Dyel, Gwok Kodi Dhyaŋ
English: Goat, Dog, and Cow
Swahili: Mbuzi, Mbwa na Ng'ombe

Adhola: Cango cango Dyel, Gwok gi Dhyaŋ jo bedo mere matek swa
English:
Goat, Dog, and Cow
were great friends
Swahili: Mbuzi, Mbwa na Ng’ombe walikuwa marafiki wa karibu sana

Adhola: Ndir acel jo kidho woth i motoka
English:
One
day they went on a
journey in a taxi
Swahili: Siku moja walisafiri kwa teksi

Adhola: Jo tundo kama joloro iye. Jagwey motoka openjo jo cul ma woth. Dhyaŋ oculo apere.
English:
When they reached the
end of their journey, the
driver asked them to
pay their fares. Cow
paid her fare.
Swahili: Walipofika mwisho wa safari yao, dereva aliwaomba walipe nauli zao. Ng’ombe alilipa nauli yake.

Adhola: Gwok oculo pesa ma thoth, rupir go oyido ongoye gi pesa ma thin
English:
Dog paid a bit extra,
because he did not
have the correct money
Swahili: Mbwa alilipa zaidi kidogo kwa sababu hakuwa na pesa taslimu

Adhola: Jagwey motoka oyido chegin dwoko ri Gwok pesa pere m’odoŋ. Dyel oŋweco woko abwap ma ku culo apere.
English:
The driver was about to
give Dog his change
when Goat ran away
without paying
anything.
Swahili: Dereva alipokaribia kumpa Mbwa chenji yake, Mbuzi alitoroka bila kulipa chochote.

Adhola: Jagwey motoka omako nge swa
English:
The driver was very
annoyed
Swahili: Dereva alikasirika sana

Adhola: Go otugila motoka to kadho ma ku dwoko ri Gwok pesa pere m’odong
English:
He drove
away without giving
Dog his change
Swahili: Aliondoka bila kumrudishia Mbwa chenji yake

Adhola: Meno, ama omiyo kiri konon, fodi Gwok ŋweco ryemo motoka ni woleŋo iye waŋe. Go rango jagwey motoka ma ku dwoko ri go pesa pere m’odoŋ.
English:
That is why, even
today, Dog runs
towards a car to peep
inside and find the
driver who owes him his
change.
Swahili: Hiyo ndiyo sababu hadi leo Mbwa hukimbiza magari ili achungulie ndani kuona kama atampata dereva mwenye chenji yake.

Adhola: Dyel ŋweco aŋweca ka owinjo mor ma motoka
English:
Goat runs away from
the sound of a car
Swahili: Mbuzi hukimbia anaposikia mlio wa gari

Adhola: Go lworo ni ile mako go rupir ndir no ku culo jagwey motoka pesa ma woth
English:
She
is afraid she will be
arrested for not paying
her fare
Swahili: Anaogopa atakamatwa kwa kutolipa nauli

Adhola: Dhyaŋ ki dew ri go kwoŋ motokin. Dhyaŋ gale a gala ka ŋado ngudo. Oŋeyo ni oculo pesa pere mawoth je.
English:
And Cow is not
bothered when a car is
coming. Cow takes her
time crossing the road
because she knows she
paid her fare in full.
Swahili: Na Ng’ombe hababaiki gari likiwa linakuja. Ng’ombe huvuka barabara bila wasiwasi kwa sababu anajua alilipa nauli yake yote.

Adhola: Nyathi Ma Nyakare
English: Donkey Child
Swahili: Mtoto Punda

Adhola: Aneno dhano to akaŋasa go tek tek
English: It was a little girl who first saw the mysterious shape in the distance
Swahili: Ilikuwa ni msichana mdogo aliyekuwa wa kwanza kuona umbo la ajabu kwa mbali

Adhola: To aneno dhako ma yac ma omako iye
English: As the shape moved closer, she saw that it was a heavily pregnant woman
Swahili: Kadiri umbo lilipokaribia, aliona kwamba lilikuwa ni mwanamke mwenye ujauzito mkubwa

Adhola: Jo calo mawan jo jolo dhako no to doŋ both wan.
English:
Shy but brave, the little girl moved nearer to the woman.

“We must keep her with us,” the little girl’s people decided. “We’ll keep her and her child safe.”
Swahili: Kwa upole na ujasiri, msichana alimsogelea mwanamke yule. “Lazima tumhifadhi,” watu wa msichana yule walisema. “Tutawaweka yeye na mtoto wake salama.”

Adhola: I dyer wor dhako no okoko ni, “Nyathi! Eno nyathi wok
English: The child was soon on its way
Swahili: Mtoto alikuwa njiani kuzaliwa si muda mrefu

English:
“Push!”

“Bring blankets!”

“Water!”

“Puuuuussssshhh!!!”
Swahili: “Sukuma!” “Leteni mablanketi!” “Maji!” “Suuukuuumaaaa!!!”

Adhola: Dhako no to nywolo punda.
English:
But when they saw the baby, everyone jumped back in shock.

“A donkey?!”
Swahili: Lakini walipomwona mtoto, wote waliruka kwa mshtuko. “Punda?!”

Adhola: Ji jo penjere ni, “Wa no tim nedi?”
English:
Everyone began to argue.

“We said we would keep mother and child safe, and that’s what we’ll do,” said some.

“But they will bring us bad luck!” said others.
Swahili: Wakaanza kubishana. “Tulisema tutawaweka mama na mtoto salama, na hivyo ndivyo tutakavyofanya,” baadhi wakasema. “Lakini watatuletea mkosi!” wengine wakadai.

Adhola: Ji jo ŋweco kwoŋ go. To dhako no paro ni, “A la timere nedi gi nyathi me?”
English:
And so the woman found herself alone again.

She wondered what to do with this awkward child.

She wondered what to do with herself.
Swahili: Kwa hiyo mwanamke yule alijikuta yuko peke yake kwa mara nyingine tena. Akajiuliza atafanya nini na mtoto huyo wa ajabu. Akajiuliza atafanya nini na yeye mwenyewe.

Adhola: Rumacen, dhako no oyere to maro nyathi pere
English: But finally she had to accept that he was her child and she was his mother
Swahili: Lakini hatimaye alikubali kwamba huyo ni mwanaye na yeye ni mama yake

Adhola: Nyathi no odongo, obedo ma dwoŋ, ma odhyero kir min tiŋo.
English:
Now, if the child had stayed that same, small size, everything might have been different. But the donkey child grew and grew until he could no longer fit on his mother’s back.

And no matter how hard he tried, he could not behave like a human being. His mother was often tired and frustrated. Sometimes she made him do work meant for animals.
Swahili: Endapo mtoto huyo angebaki kuwa vilevile, na umbo dogo, labda kila kitu kingekuwa tofauti. Lakini mtoto Punda aliendelea kukua na kukua mpaka hakuweza kutoshea tena mgongoni mwa mama yake. Pamoja na kujaribu kwa bidii, hakuweza kuwa na tabia za kibinadamu. Mara nyingi mama yake alichoka na kuvunjika moyo. Wakati mwingine alimlazimisha kufanya kazi walizostahili wanyama.

Adhola: Min obedo gi gut. Nyathi pere bende omako nge to gweyo go.
English:
Confusion and anger built up inside Donkey. He couldn’t do this and he couldn’t do that. He couldn’t be like this and he couldn’t be like that.

He became so angry that, one day, he kicked his mother to the ground.
Swahili: Kuchanganyikiwa na hasira vilianza kujengeka ndani mwa Punda. Alishindwa kufanya hivi wala vile. Alishindwa kuwa hivi wala vile. Alipatwa na hasira sana kiasi kwamba, siku moja, alimpiga teke mama yake mpaka akaanguka chini.

Adhola: Oŋweco woko munyo oneno min opodho piny.
English: Donkey was filled with shame. He started to run away as far and fast as he could.
Swahili: Punda alijawa na aibu. Akaanza kukimbilia mbali kwa haraka kadiri awezavyo.

Adhola: Nyathi punda odoŋ kende, kec oneko, ool, to nindo kwalo.
English:
By the time he stopped running, it was night, and Donkey was lost.

“Hee haw?” he whispered to the darkness.

“Hee Haw?” it echoed back. He was alone.

Curling himself into a tight ball, he fell into a deep and troubled sleep.
Swahili: Wakati aliposimama, ilikuwa ni usiku, na alikuwa amepotea. “Hii hoo?” alinong’ona gizani. “Hii hoo?” giza likatoa mwangwi. Alikuwa mwenyewe. Alijikunyata katika umbo dogo, akalala fofofo usingizi wa mang’amung’amu.

Adhola: Munyo nyathi punda ocew, oneno jal moro ocungo dho bothe.
English: Donkey woke up to find a strange old man staring down at him. He looked into the old man’s eyes and started to feel a twinkle of hope.
Swahili: Punda aliamka na kumkuta mzee mmoja wa ajabu akimtazama. Akamwangalia mzee yule machoni na akaanza kuhisi ishara ya matumaini.

Adhola: Jalo otiŋo go to dok gine peco pere.
English:
Donkey went to stay with the old man, who taught him many different ways to survive.

Donkey listened and learned, and so did the old man. They helped each other, and they laughed together.
Swahili: Punda alienda kuishi na mzee yule, na mzee alimfundisha mbinu nyingi za kuishi. Punda alisikiliza na kujifunza, na mzee vivyo hivyo pia. Walisaidiana na kucheka pamoja.

Adhola: Nyathi punda otiŋo jalo i gongo munyo otegino
English: One morning, the old man asked Donkey to carry him to the top of a mountain
Swahili: Asubuhi moja, mzee alimwomba Punda ambebe hadi kwenye kilele cha mlima

Adhola: Ndir acel, jo idho wi got moro kir malo, jo ol to jo podho nindo.
English:
High up amongst the clouds they fell asleep.

Donkey dreamed that his mother was sick and calling to him.

And when he woke up…
Swahili: Walipofika juu kwenye mawingu, walipatwa na usingizi. Punda akaota kuwa mama yake alikuwa mgonjwa na alimhitaji. Na alipoamka…

Adhola: Munyo nyathi punda ocew, onwaŋo ni nitye kende kendo
English: … the clouds had disappeared along with his friend, the old man
Swahili: …mawingu yalikuwa yametoweka pamoja na rafiki yake, yule mzee

Adhola: Nyathi punda obedo gi gut. Owotho ka gi kaca rango min.
English: Donkey finally knew what to do.
Swahili: Hatimaye, Punda alijua alichotakiwa kufanya.

Adhola: Nyathi punda oneno dhano moro to penjere ni, “Meno
English:
Donkey found his mother, alone and mourning her lost child. They stared at each other for a long time.

And then hugged each other very hard.
Swahili: Punda alimkuta mama yake akiwa peke yake huku akimwomboleza mwanaye aliyepotea. Wakaangaliana kwa muda mrefu. Na kisha wakakumbatiana kwa hisia.

Adhola: Wok i ndiri no nyahti punda gi min jo bedo ka nyacel
English: The donkey child and his mother have grown together and found many ways of living side by side
Swahili: Mtoto Punda na mama yake wamekuwa kitu kimoja na kuishi kwa ushirikiano

Adhola: Tiŋo min to wotho gi ne
English: Slowly, all around them, other families have started to settle
Swahili: Taratibu, familia nyingine zimeanza kuhamia na kuishi miongoni mwao

Adhola: Ywomirok Bothi Adhadha
English: Holidays with grandmother
Swahili: Likizo kwa bibi

Adhola: Odongo gi Apiyo jobedo gi ba jo i tindi madwoŋ
English: Odongo and Apiyo lived in the city with their father
Swahili: Odongo na Apiyo waliishi mjini na baba yao

Adhola: Jo bedo ka jo kiyo akiya ywomirok
English: They looked forward to the holidays
Swahili: Walisubiri likizo kwa hamu

Adhola: Ki rupir sikulu i lacego, to rupir jowanya kidho lyewo adha jo
English: Not just because school was closed, but because they went to visit their grandmother
Swahili: Siyo tu kwa shule kufungwa, bali ni kwa sababu walienda kumtembelea bibi yao

Adhola: Go bedo yoloka pa jokitoga ger gi nam madwoŋ
English: She lived in a fishing village near a large lake
Swahili: Aliishi katika kijiji cha uvuvi karibu na ziwa kubwa

Adhola: Odongo gi Apiyo jo sangala swa rupir hongo otundo ma kidho lyewo adha jo kendo
English: Odongo and Apiyo were excited because it was time to visit their grandmother again
Swahili: Odongo na Apiyo walichangamka kwani ulikuwa wakati wa kumtembelea bibi kwa mara nyingine

Adhola: Wor m’otelo jo tweyo migugu pa jo to jo yikere ma woth ma kidho loka p’adha jo
English: The night before, they packed their bags and got ready for the long journey to her village
Swahili: Usiku huo, walipanga mizigo yao na kujiandaa kwa safari ndefu ya kwenda kijijini

Adhola: Nindo kumako waŋ jo aka jo luwo kwoŋ lyewo adha jo wor gi pi
English: They could not sleep and talked the whole night about the holiday
Swahili: Hawakuweza kulala ila waliongea usiku kucha juu ya likizo yao

Adhola: Jo mondo yawere mere kadho p’adha jo i mutoka pa ba jo
English: Early the next morning, they left for the village in their father’s car
Swahili: Mapema asubuhi iliyofuata, waliondoka katika gari la baba yao kuelekea kijijini

Adhola: Ogwey gi jo motoka kalo gote, ogwange ma dudi gi ndelin majan
English: They drove past mountains, wild animals and tea plantations
Swahili: Walipita milima, wanyama pori na mashamba ya majani ya chai

Adhola: Jo kwano motokin aka jowero
English: They counted cars and sang songs
Swahili: Walihesabu magari na kuimba nyimbo

Adhola: Rumacen nyithindho jo ol to jo podho nindo
English: After a while, the children were tired and fell asleep
Swahili: Baada ya muda, watoto walichoka na kusinzia

Adhola: Ba jo ocewo jo munyo jo tundo loka ago. Jo nwaŋo adha jo, Nyajaruya, ywomere i tyendi yath i par.
English:
Father woke up Odongo and Apiyo as they arrived in the village.

They found Nyar-Kanyada, their grandmother, resting on a mat under a tree.

Nyar-Kanyada in Luo, means ‘daughter of the people of Kanyada’. She was a strong and beautiful woman.
Swahili: Baba aliwaamsha Odongo na Apiyo walipofika kijijini. Walimkuta bibi yao, Nyar-Kanyada, akipumzika kwenye mkeka chini ya mti. Kwa Dholuo, Nyar-Kanyada maana yake ni ‘binti wa watu wa Kanyada’. Alikuwa ni mwanamke mrembo na imara.

Adhola: Nyajaruwa osangala gi jo, orwako jo i ot to mielo thoko dier ot
English: Nyar-Kanyada welcomed them into the house and danced around the room singing with joy
Swahili: Nyar-Kanyada aliwakaribisha ndani kwa kucheza na kuimba kwa furaha

Adhola: Nyikwaye jo miyo go mic ma jo kelo wok i tindi madwoŋ
English: Her grandchildren were excited to give her the presents they brought from the city
Swahili: Wajukuu wake walikuwa na shauku ya kumpa zawadi walizomletea kutoka mjini

Adhola: Odongo owaco ni, “Tel yawo mic paran
English: “First open my gift,” said Odongo
Swahili: “Fungua yangu kwanza,” Odongo alisema

Adhola: ” Apiyo bende owaco ni, “Be, tel g’aparan ayino!”
English: “No, my gift first!” said Apiyo
Swahili: “Hapana, yangu kwanza!” Apiyo akasema

Adhola: Munyo Nyajaruwa ocowo yawo mic je, omiyo nyikwaye silwany i kula ma nyanono pa jo
English: After she opened the presents, Nyar-Kanyada blessed her grandchildren in a traditional way
Swahili: Baada ya kufungua zawadi, Nyar-Kanyada aliwabariki wajukuu wake kitamaduni

Adhola: Odongo gi Apiyo to jowok kadho tuko
English: Then Odongo and Apiyo went outside
Swahili: Kisha Odongo na Apiyo wakaenda nje

Adhola: Jo riemo ombutuku gi winyin
English: They chased butterflies and birds
Swahili: Waliwakimbiza vipepeo na ndege

Adhola: Jo idho yen to jo tuko i pi ma nam
English: They climbed trees and splashed in the water of the lake
Swahili: Walipanda kwenye miti na kurushiana maji ziwani

Adhola: Munyo piny oyutho jo dok peco cemo m’othieno
English: When it was dark they returned to the house for dinner
Swahili: Giza Iilipoingia, walirudi nyumbani kwa ajili ya chakula cha jioni

Adhola: Jo podho nindo mafodi jo kucowo kada cemo!
English: Before they could finish eating, they were falling asleep!
Swahili: Kabla hata ya kumaliza kula, walikuwa wanasinzia!

Adhola: Yawere mere ba nyithindho no ogweyo mutoka pere dok i tindi madwoŋ to weyo jo gi adha jo
English: The next day, the children’s father drove back to the city leaving them with Nyar-Kanyada
Swahili: Siku iliyofuata, baba yao alirudi mjini na kuwaacha na Nyar-Kanyada

Adhola: Odongo gi Apiyo jo konyo adha jo gi tic ma peco
English: Odongo and Apiyo helped their grandmother with household chores
Swahili: Odongo na Apiyo walimsaidia bibi yao na kazi za nyumbani

Adhola: Jo kulo pi to jo dimo yen
English: They fetched water and firewood
Swahili: Walichota maji na kuokota kuni

Adhola: Jo coko toŋgwendi to joŋweto fufa
English: They collected eggs from the chickens and picked greens from the garden
Swahili: Walikusanya mayai ya kuku na kuchuma mboga za majani kutoka kwenye bustani

Adhola: Nyajaruwa ofonjo nyikwaye guro kwon mayom macamere gi fufa
English: Nyar-Kanyada taught her grandchildren to make soft ugali to eat with stew
Swahili: Nyar-Kanyada aliwafundisha wajukuu wake jinsi ya kupika ugali mwepesi wa kula na mchuzi

Adhola: Onyutho jo kite matedo micere gi cak nazi ma camera gi rec abula
English: She showed them how to make coconut rice to eat with roast fish
Swahili: Aliwaonesha namna ya kupika wali wa nazi wa kuliwa na samaki wa kukaanga

Adhola: Odikini acel Odongo okidho kwayo dhok p’adhamere
English: One morning, Odongo took his grandmother’s cows to graze
Swahili: Asubuhi moja, Odongo aliwapeleka ng’ombe wa bibi yake malishoni

Adhola: Jo donjo i ndelo pa jager
English: They ran onto a neighbour’s farm
Swahili: Wakakimbilia ndani ya shamba la jirani

Adhola: Won ndelo omako nge gi Odongo
English: The farmer was angry with Odongo
Swahili: Mwenye shamba alikasirishwa sana na Odongo

Adhola: Obwoko go ni ladoŋ gi dhoki rupir jo camo cemo pere
English: He threatened to keep the cows for eating his crops
Swahili: Akatishia kuwazuia ng’ombe kula mimea yake

Adhola: Wok ndelo no Odongo ogwoko dhoki timo banja kendo
English: After that day, the boy made sure that the cows did not get into trouble again
Swahili: Tangu siku hiyo, Odongo alihakikisha kwamba ng’ombe hawaingii matatani tena

Adhola: Ndelo man nyithindho jokidho i kisiya gi adha jo
English: On another day, the children went to the marketplace with Nyar-Kanyada
Swahili: Siku nyingine watoto walikwenda sokoni pamoja na Nyar-Kanyada

Adhola: Go oyido nitie gi kitandilo m’atana iye fufa, sukari gi sabuni
English: She had a stall selling vegetables, sugar and soap
Swahili: Nyar-Kanyada alikuwa na kibanda cha kuuza mboga, sukari na sabuni

Adhola: Apiyo omaro waco ri jonyew welo ma gigipiny
English: Apiyo liked to tell customers the price of items
Swahili: Apiyo alipenda kuwatajia wateja bei za bidhaa

Adhola: Odongo oyido tweyo gigipiny m’otiek nyewo
English: Odongo would pack the items that customers bought
Swahili: Odongo aliwafungia wateja bidhaa walizonunua

Adhola: I cowe mere jo madho cai kanyacel
English: At the end of the day they drank chai tea together
Swahili: Mwisho wa siku walikunywa chai pamoja

Adhola: Jo konyo adha jo gi kwano pesa m’olimo
English: They helped grandmother to count the money she earned
Swahili: Walimsaidia bibi yao kuhesabu pesa alizozipata

Adhola: Mayot yot ywomirok orumo aka oripo ni nyithindho no jo wodoki i tindi pa jo
English: But too soon the holidays were over and the children had to go back to the city
Swahili: Likizo ilikaribia kuisha na watoto walitakiwa kurudi mjini

Adhola: Nyajaruwa omiyo Odongo junga to miyo Apiyo sweta
English: Nyar-Kanyada gave Odongo a cap and Apiyo a sweater
Swahili: Nyar-Kanyada alimpa Odongo kofia na Apiyo sweta

Adhola: Otweyo ri jo kit cemo ma camo iyo
English: She packed food for their journey
Swahili: Aliwafungia chakula cha kula safarini

Adhola: Munyo ba jo obino omo jo, oyido jo kumito dok
English: When their father came to fetch them, they did not want to leave
Swahili: Baba yao alipokuja kuwachukua, hawakutaka kuondoka

Adhola: Nyithindho jo kwayo adha jo dok gi jo i tindi madwoŋ
English: The children begged Nyar-Kanyada to go with them to the city
Swahili: Walimuomba Nyar-Kanyada aende nao mjini

Adhola: Obwonjo to waco ni,  “Aasa ti ma kidho i tindi madwoŋ
English: She smiled and said, “I am too old for the city
Swahili: Alitabasamu na kusema, “Nimezeeka, siyawezi ya mjini

Adhola: Alabedo ka akur win bino thurin kendo
English: I will be waiting for you to come to my village again
Swahili: Nitasubiri mje kijijini kwangu tena

Adhola: Odongo gi Apiyo jopodho i kor adha jo ma joridho matek aka jo sewila go
English: Odongo and Apiyo both hugged her tightly and said goodbye
Swahili: Odongo na Apiyo walimkumbatia kwa pamoja na kumuaga

Adhola: Munyo Odongo gi Apiyo jo dok i sikulu jo lyesa ri wadi gin kwoŋ kwo ma calo
English: When Odongo and Apiyo went back to school they told their friends about life in the village
Swahili: Odongo na Apiyo waliporudi shuleni, waliwasimulia marafiki zao kuhusu maisha ya kijijini

Adhola: Nyithindho megi jo paro ni kwo ma tindi ber
English: Some children felt that life in the city was good
Swahili: Baadhi ya watoto waliamini kuwa maisha ya mjini ni mazuri

Adhola: Megi jo paro ni calo ber loyo
English: Others felt that the village was better
Swahili: Wengine waliamini kijijini ni bora zaidi

Adhola: To m’oloyo aloya swa kis dhano oyeyo ni Odongo gi Apiyo jo nitie gi adha jo maber m’oasere!
English: But most of all, everyone agreed that Odongo and Apiyo had a wonderful grandmother!
Swahili: Lakini zaidi ya yote, kila mmoja alikubali kwamba Odongo na Apiyo walikuwa na bibi wa kipekee

Adhola: Gweno Kodi Ongongolo
English: Chicken and Millipede
Swahili: Kuku na Jongoo

Adhola: Gweno kodi Ongongolo oyido mere
English: Chicken and Millipede were friends
Swahili: Kuku na Jongoo walikuwa marafiki

Adhola: To oyido ju tere pyemo gi achieli kwong jo
English: But they were always competing with each other
Swahili: Ila walikuwa wanashindana kila mara

Adhola: Ndelo achieli ju yiko tuko mupira nyaka juneni jatuko maberi
English: One day they decided to play football to see who the best player was
Swahili: Siku moja wakaamua kucheza mpira wa miguu ili waweze kubaini nani alikuwa mchezaji bora zaidi

Adhola: Jukadho ikisawe toju chako tuko pajo
English: They went to the football field and started their game
Swahili: Wakaenda uwanjani na wakaanza kucheza

Adhola: Gweno oyido ni piyopiyo to Ongongolo oyido nipiyo swa
English: Chicken was fast, but Millipede was faster
Swahili: Kuku alikuwa na kasi ila Jongoo alikuwa na kasi zaidi

Adhola: Gweno ogeyo mupira bori to Ongongolo ogweyo bori swa
English: Chicken kicked far, but Millipede kicked further
Swahili: Kuku alipiga mpira mbali, ila Jongoo alipiga mbali zaidi

Adhola: Gweno to chako winjo nywowiroki
English: Chicken started to feel grumpy
Swahili: Kuku akaanza kupandwa na hasira

Adhola: Juyiko tuko makitewa neno ngata oloyi
English: They decided to play a penalty shoot-out
Swahili: Wakaamua kupigiana penati

Adhola: Ongongolo obedo jamaki gole
English: First Millipede was goal keeper
Swahili: Jongoo akaenda golini

Adhola: Gweno otewa gole achieli
English: Chicken scored only one goal
Swahili: Kuku alifunga goli moja pekee

Adhola: Nyo totundo sawa pa Gweno ma makuro gole
English: Then it was the chicken’s turn to defend the goal
Swahili: Ikawa zamu ya kuku kwenda golini

Adhola: Ongongolo ogweyo mupira totewa
English: Millipede kicked the ball and scored
Swahili: Jongoo alipiga mpira akafunga

Adhola: Ongongolo oketa mupira totewa
English: Millipede dribbled the ball and scored
Swahili: Jongoo akapiga chenga akafunga

Adhola: Ongongolo ogoyo mupira giwiye totewa
English: Millipede headed the ball and scored
Swahili: Jongoo akapiga kichwa akafunga

Adhola: Ongongolo otewa gole abich!
English: Millipede scored five goals
Swahili: Jongoo akafunga magoli matano

Adhola: Gweno omako nge ni go ofiriwa
English: Chicken was furious that she lost
Swahili: Kuku akakasirika kwa kuwa amefungwa

Adhola: Go oyido obedo jakifiriwa marachi swa
English: She was a very bad loser
Swahili: Hakuwa mshindani mzuri

Adhola: Ongongolo ochako nyero rupiri mere pere oyido timo ginyero
English: Millipede started laughing because his friend was making such a fuss
Swahili: Jongoo akaanza kucheka kwa sababu rafiki yake alikuwa analalamika

Adhola: Gweno omako nge to yawo dhoke malachi swa to mwonyo Ongongolo
English: Chicken was so angry that she opened her beak wide and swallowed the millipede
Swahili: Kuku alipatwa na hasira kiasi kwamba akafungua mdomo wake mkubwa na akammeza Jongoo

Adhola: Munyo Gweno oyido doki pecho, go oromo gi yoki Ongongolo
English: As Chicken was walking home, she met Mother Millipede
Swahili: Kuku alipokuwa anarudi nyumbani alikutana na Mama yake Jongoo

Adhola: Yoki Ongongolo openjo ni ineno ye nyathi parani? Gweno ku wacho gimoro jye
English: Mother Millipede asked, “Have you seen my child?” Chicken didn’t say anything
Swahili: Mama Jongoo akamuuliza, “Umemwona mwanangu?” Kuku hakujibu kitu

Adhola: Yoki Ongongolo obedo gi rembo
English: Mother Millipede was worried
Swahili: Mama Jongoo akapatwa na wasiwasi

Adhola: Nyaka to yoki Ongongolo winjo dwondo jo mathini
English: Then Mother Millipede heard a tiny voice
Swahili: Mama Jongoo akasikia sauti kwa mbali

Adhola: Konyani Mama dwondi jo oywaki
English: “Help me mom!” cried the voice
Swahili: “Nisaidie mama!” ile sauti ililia

Adhola: Yoki Ongongolo ongiyo thubongi go to winjo gi kikangasa swa
English: Mother Millipede looked around and listened carefully
Swahili: Mama Jongoo akaangalia huku na kule na kusikiliza kwa makini

Adhola: Dwondi jo owoki iyii Gweno
English: The voice came from inside the chicken
Swahili: Sauti ilitokea tumboni mwa kuku

Adhola: Yoki Ongongolo okoko, ori meni perini ma were omiyini nyathi paran! Ongongolo nyalo wotho ngweche marachi swa makibilere
English: Mother Millipede shouted, “Use your special power my child!” Millipedes can make a bad smell and a terrible taste
Swahili: Mama Jongoo alipiga kelele, “Tumia nguvu yako ya kipekee mwanangu!” Majongoo wanaweza kutoa harufu mbaya na ladha ya ajabu

Adhola: Gweno ochako kichiroki pa two
English: Chicken began to feel ill
Swahili: Kuku akaanza kujisikia mgonjwa

Adhola: Gweno ochukere. Nyaka to mwonyo gi ngulo. Nyaka to jiro gi wolo. Munyo owolo Ongongolo ochali pa oyido kimiti.
English: Chicken burped. Then she swallowed and spat. Then she sneezed and coughed. And coughed. The millipede was disgusting!
Swahili: Kuku akabeuwa. Akameza mate na kutema. Halafu akapiga chafya na kukohoa. Akakohoa tena. Jongoo alimfanya ajisikie vibaya.

Adhola: Gweno owolo nyuka owolo woko Ongongolo iyii go
English: Chicken coughed until she coughed out the millipede that was in her stomach
Swahili: Kuku alikohoa, hadi akamtema jongoo aliyekuwa tumboni mwake

Adhola: Yoki Ongongolo gi nyathi pere jurweta malo iwi yathi pondo
English: Mother Millipede and her child crawled up a tree to hide
Swahili: Mama Jongoo na mwanaye wakakwea mti kujificha

Adhola: Woki isawa no, Gwendi kodi Ongongolini jubedo jukwori
English: From that time, chickens and millipedes were enemies
Swahili: Tangu hapo, Kuku na Jongoo ni maadui
